title: Terra Blade
summaries: The Terra Blade is a Hardmode projectile sword crafted by combining the True Excalibur and True Night's Edge. The Terra Blade becomes available after defeating Plantera / one mechanical boss / all mechanical bosses, depending on the game's version.

On the [img:Desktop version] Desktop version, [img:Console version] Console version, and [img:Mobile version] Mobile version, it fires a wide green slash wave projectile each swing. It also has a large aura of energy around the blade when swung, which significantly increases the range at which the weapon can deal damage to enemies, including coverage behind the player. The projectile deals 100% base damage at first, pierces an infinite amount of targets, and apply a 25% damage penalty for each target it pierces. The projectile will disappear after 1.5 seconds, upon hitting a solid block, or when its damage falls to 0 after piercing. If the blade, its energy, or its projectile strikes an enemy, a green flash will be created.

On the [img:Old-gen console version] Old-gen console version, Nintendo 3DS[img:Nintendo 3DS version] version, and [img:Legacy tModLoader version] Legacy tModLoader version, it fires a green sword-shaped projectile when swung, which costs neither mana nor ammunition, deals 125% base damage, and can pierce through two enemies, dissipating after hitting a third enemy or a wall. The projectile can travel up to 5000 feet (2500 tiles) at a speed of 61 mph. The fire rate and velocity of the projectile can be increased by melee speed bonuses.

On the [img:Desktop version] Desktop version, [img:Console version] Console version, and [img:Mobile version] Mobile version, it is later used to craft the Zenith, which is the strongest melee weapon in the game. On the [img:Old-gen console version] Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS[img:Nintendo 3DS version] version, the Terra Blade itself is one of the strongest swords in the game.
